title: Discussion Facilitation Strategies in Online Instructional Design: Applying Case-Based Learning (CBL)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and experience with online learning environments
context.additional_context: Offline classes for corporate language education managers and practitioners in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) settings, emphasizing discussion strategies derived from case-based learning for real-world application.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods to facilitate discussions using social congruence strategies in online environments.
Learners can design approaches to promote learners' thinking by applying cognitive congruence strategies during case analysis.
Learners can perform the role of a content expert based on advanced domain expertise and establish a feedback provision system.
Learners can develop discussion facilitation scenarios that integrate three strategies (social/cognitive congruence, content expertise).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
